topics.body:
So my mom told me that Apple has a program where you can apply to be a customer service rep from home and it pays pretty well and I should sign up. 
I totally would because that would be great but talking to strangers over the phone makes me feel so stressed that my head feels like it's on fire. 
Plus apparently customers have to pay before you can help them and a lot of them don't realize that. As you would expect, some of them would be pretty pissed.  I don't think I could handle that. 
PLUS the training is apparently pretty intense. Like, fail one test and you're out. 
And if you get a single bad customer survey,it takes up to five to get you back to a good status. 

Basically what I'm saying is that this would be a really good opportunity for me but I would probably end up a whimpering pile of tears after the first week
topics.author: 500b587e7f123b1f230014a9

topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/551792546368720c76420c00#post_551792546368720c76420c00

I had an instance when I receive nosebleeds for no reason. They are hard to stop and come at the worst time possible. After a classmate slamdunked me in PE class one day during 12th grade, I kept receiving nosebleeds through my graduation.
